name: some-sass
displayName: Some Sass: extended support for SCSS and SassDoc
description: Full support for @use and @forward, including aliases, prefixes and hiding. Rich documentation through SassDoc. Workspace-wide code navigation and refactoring.

somesass.scannerDepth.description: The maximum number of nested directories to scan.

somesass.scannerExclude.description: List of glob patterns for directories that are excluded when scanning.

somesass.scanImportedFiles.deprecationMessage: Will be removed at some point after `@import` becomes CSS-only.
somesass.scanImportedFiles.description: Allows scan imported files. Turning this off will severely limit functionality, and is not recommended.

somesass.suggestionStyle.description: Controls the style of suggestions for mixins and placeholders.
enumDescriptions: Where brackets are suggested, omit duplicates without brackets

somesass.suggestAllFromOpenDocument.description: VS Code has built-in code suggestions for symbols declared in the open document. If you prefer the suggestions from Some Sass, you can opt in by turning on this setting. There will be duplicates.

somesass.suggestFromUseOnly.description: If your project uses the new module system with @use and @forward, you may want to only include suggestions from your used modules.

somesass.suggestFunctionsInStringContext.description: Allows prompt Functions in String context after specified symbols.

scripts.build: npm run clean && webpack --mode production --devtool hidden-source-map
scripts.build:debug: npm run clean && webpack --mode development --devtool hidden-source-map
scripts.test:e2e: npm run build && cd e2e && npm test
scripts.pretest:web: webpack --config ./webpack.test-web.config.js && cd web && npm run compile
scripts.postinstall: cd client && npm install && cd ../e2e && npm install && cd ../server && npm install && cd ../web && npm install
